page.title: 09Murder Mile
page.content: Over a tunnel leading to Ivy Walk runs a train track, known in Coventry as 'Murder Mile'. A train driver was killed and many have been injured by children and teenagers throwing stones at trains. One train driver who was injured came to school to warn us about the dangers of playing on the railway. Train drivers have to wear special caps with hard peaks to protect their eyes from flying glass, and cabs are fitted with a 'dead mans handle ' which stops the train if the driver collapses. Sometimes teenagers put obstacles on the track which could derail the train, so this summer the police have a special 'Q' force which are on the lookout for anyone who trespasses on railway land endangering lives.
